Key Match Events: The Thunder scored 31 total points off turnovers in the win.
Oklahoma City forced seven turnovers in the third quarter and turned those into 17 points on the other end to help them outscore the Clippers 42-20 in the frame.
Post-Match Reflections: Oklahoma City Thunder forward Jalen Williams scored 18 for the Thunder, and they will look to win their 14th straight game on Friday against the New York Knicks.
Thunder coach Mark Daigneault sat Shai Gilgeous-Alexander for the entire fourth quarter on the first night of a back-to-back.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Los Angeles — missing James Harden (right groin soreness) for this contest — has lost back-to-back games. It was just Harden’s second missed game of the season.
Amir Coffey led Los Angeles with a season-high 26 points.
The Clippers got off to a hot start offensively, making seven of their first 10 shots, while the Thunder was cold, especially from deep.
